did.head: Overview

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Stanford University. Goldman Interschool Honors Program in Environmental Science, Technology, and Policy.

did.unittitle: Stanford University, Goldman Interschool Honors Program in Environmental Science, Technology, and Policy, theses
did.abstract: Honors theses written by undergraduates in the Goldman Interschool Honors Program in Environmental Science, Technology, and Policy at Stanford University

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Dept. of Special Collections & University Archives.

acqinfo.p: Theses were transferred to the Stanford University Archives from the Hume Writing Center in 2011.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research use; materials must be requested at least 48 hours in advance of intended use. No photocopies may be made.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the creators for materials they have authored or otherwise produced. Transmission or reproduction of materials requires the written permission of the copyright owner.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Stanford University, Goldman Interschool Honors Progfram in Environmental Science, Technology, and Policy, Theses (SC4-6535). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of honors theses written by undergraduates in the Goldman Interschool Honors Program in Environmental Science, Technology, and Policy at Stanford University

did.unittitle: Theses
Adelman, Sarah Wallace, Assessing the economic value of native bee pollination services on Yolo County wasterman farms.
Bagolino, Andrew D., First Degree Impacts of Hydrogen as a Transport Fuel: New Zealand as a Case Study.
Carrothers, T. J. [Timothy], Applying pollution prevention for organochlorine policy.
Chaplin, Rebecca Ellen, Searching for the source: how understanding habitat quality can improve marine reserve design.
Chen, Helen Y. , The feasibility of recycling construction and demolition waste in Hong Kong: a look at politics, economics, and environmental impact.
Griego, Hannah R., The conservation and management of California black abalone: implications of habitat structure.
Levy, Karen, The utility of Ithomiinae (Lepidoptera: Nymphalidae) as indicators of forest disturbance: a case study of the applicability of biological research to conservation.
Lewis, Jessa, Alternatives to intensified coffee production in Costa Rica: an analysis of three more sustainable production systems.
Malk, Andrew J., Management indicator species: a critique of existing practices and recommendations for future use.
Mannor, Adi and Eric Selmon, Beyond compliance: perceptions affecting corporate envoronmentalism in the chemical industry.
Menge, Duncan Nicholas Lubchenco, Phosphorus! Or: anthropogenic global environmental changes and phosphorus limitation: interactions and implications.
Mercer, Jason, Keeping it at home: environmental altruism and Germany's ban on toxic waste exports.
Plaut, Karen, The depletion of the Ogallala aquifer: management alternatives.
Robinson, Sarah M., Of malaria and models: a biological approach to modeling breeding pools and mosquitoes for malaria transmission models.
Spencer, Kipchoge, Crazy for kilowatts: how Stanford University's voracious energy appetite is bad for business, un-green, and eminently curable.
Stewart, Vanessa Eliot-Hudson, Swedish regulation of GMOs: process, product, or politics?.
Wada, Nikolas, The impact of El Nino on the world fishmeal market.
Theses
Levine, Jessica, All on board? Aligning environmental sustainability and social justice in the mass transit sector.
